bibl.title: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, September 28, 1916

div1.p: Stimpson discusses Carter's request for a leave of absence.

div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, September 28, 1916
div1.opener:
JKb
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
PAB
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
September 28, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
C/O International Health Commission,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Bureau is in receipt of your letter dated San Juan,
P. R., September 17, 1916, in the matter of your leave of
absence. You are informed that you were granted one month's
additional leave of absence with pay from September 20, 1916,
by Department letter dated August 9, 1916, and that your ap-
plication for two month's additional leave without pay from
October 20, 1916, has been forwarded to the Department ap-
proved and will be granted in a few days, so you need feel
no further concern as to your leave status while absent on
your present detail.

It is noted that you expect to return by about December
10, 1916, and any unused portion of your leave without pay
will be revoked upon your return to duty.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, WG Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General.
